p: ROS generated in response to viral infection in epithelial cells can lead to lung injury by inducing oxidative stress and inflammation [ 53]. Mitochondrial ROS can regulate the sensitivity of mosquito intestinal epithelium to Plasmodium infection [ 54]. In our study, the DENV and ZIKV viral titer in the HPX8C-depleted mosquitoes decreased significantly (Figs 6F and 6G and 7C). The level of HPX8c affects both DENV and ZIKV levels, indicating that the role of HPX8C is universal. In the HPX8C-depleted mosquitoes, there was an increase in ROS activity ( Fig 6D and 6E).
